extended_type_info_typeid.hpp

00001 #ifndef BOOST_SERIALIZATION_EXTENDED_TYPE_INFO_TYPEID_HPP
00002 #define BOOST_SERIALIZATION_EXTENDED_TYPE_INFO_TYPEID_HPP
00003 
00005 // MS compatible compilers support #pragma once
00006 #if defined(_MSC_VER) && (_MSC_VER >= 1020)
00007 # pragma once
00008 #endif
00009 
00010 // extended_type_info_typeid.hpp: implementation for version that depends
00011 // on runtime typing (rtti - typeid) but uses a user specified string
00012 // as the portable class identifier.
00013 
00014 // (C) Copyright 2002 Robert Ramey - http://www.rrsd.com . 
00015 // Use, modification and distribution is subject to the Boost Software
00016 // License, Version 1.0. (See accompanying file LICENSE_1_0.txt or copy at
00017 // http://www.boost.org/LICENSE_1_0.txt)
00018 
00019 //  See http://www.boost.org for updates, documentation, and revision history.
00020 
00021 #include <typeinfo>
00022 #include <cstdarg>
00023 #include <cassert>
00024 #include <boost/config.hpp>
00025 
00026 #include <boost/static_assert.hpp>
00027 #include <boost/serialization/static_warning.hpp>
00028 #include <boost/type_traits/is_polymorphic.hpp>
00029 #include <boost/type_traits/remove_const.hpp>
00030 
00031 #include <boost/serialization/singleton.hpp>
00032 #include <boost/serialization/extended_type_info.hpp>
00033 #include <boost/serialization/factory.hpp>
00034 
00035 #include <boost/config/abi_prefix.hpp> // must be the last header
00036 #ifdef BOOST_MSVC
00037 #  pragma warning(push)
00038 #  pragma warning(disable : 4251 4231 4660 4275)
00039 #endif
00040 
00041 namespace boost {
00042 namespace serialization {
00043 namespace detail {
00044 
00045 class BOOST_SERIALIZATION_DECL(BOOST_PP_EMPTY()) extended_type_info_typeid_0 : 
00046     public extended_type_info
00047 {
00048 protected:
00049     const std::type_info * m_ti;
00050     extended_type_info_typeid_0();
00051     ~extended_type_info_typeid_0();
00052     void type_register(const std::type_info & ti);
00053     void type_unregister();
00054     const extended_type_info *
00055     get_extended_type_info(const std::type_info & ti) const;
00056 public:
00057     virtual bool
00058     is_less_than(const extended_type_info &rhs) const;
00059     virtual bool
00060     is_equal(const extended_type_info &rhs) const;
00061     const std::type_info & get_typeid() const {
00062         return *m_ti;
00063     }
00064 };
00065 
00066 } // namespace detail
00067 
00068 template<class T>
00069 class extended_type_info_typeid : 
00070     public detail::extended_type_info_typeid_0,
00071     public singleton<extended_type_info_typeid<T> >
00072 {
00073 public:
00074     extended_type_info_typeid() :
00075         detail::extended_type_info_typeid_0()
00076     {
00077         type_register(typeid(T));
00078     }
00079     ~extended_type_info_typeid(){
00080         type_unregister();
00081     }
00082     // get the eti record for the true type of this record
00083     // relying upon standard type info implemenation (rtti)
00084     const extended_type_info *
00085     get_derived_extended_type_info(const T & t) const {
00086         // note: this implementation - based on usage of typeid (rtti)
00087         // only does something if the class has at least one virtual function.
00088         BOOST_STATIC_WARNING(boost::is_polymorphic<T>::value);
00089         return 
00090             detail::extended_type_info_typeid_0::get_extended_type_info(
00091                 typeid(t)
00092             );
00093     }
00094     void * construct(unsigned int count, ...) const{
00095         // count up the arguments
00096         std::va_list ap;
00097         va_start(ap, count);
00098         switch(count){
00099         case 0:
00100             return factory<boost::remove_const<T>, 0>(ap);
00101         case 1:
00102             return factory<boost::remove_const<T>, 1>(ap);
00103         case 2:
00104             return factory<boost::remove_const<T>, 2>(ap);
00105         case 3:
00106             return factory<boost::remove_const<T>, 3>(ap);
00107         case 4:
00108             return factory<boost::remove_const<T>, 4>(ap);
00109         default:
00110             assert(false); // too many arguments
00111             // throw exception here?
00112             return NULL;
00113         }
00114     }
00115     void destroy(void const * const /* p */) const {
00116         // the only current usage of extended type info is in the
00117         // serialization library.  The statement below requires
00118         // that destructor of type T be public and this creates
00119         // a problem for some users.  So, for now, comment this
00120         // out 
00121         //delete static_cast<T const *>(p);
00122         // and trap any attempt to invoke this function
00123         assert(false);
00124     }
00125 };
00126 
00127 } // namespace serialization
00128 } // namespace boost
00129 
00131 // If no other implementation has been designated as default, 
00132 // use this one.  To use this implementation as the default, specify it
00133 // before any of the other headers.
00134 #ifndef BOOST_SERIALIZATION_DEFAULT_TYPE_INFO
00135     #define BOOST_SERIALIZATION_DEFAULT_TYPE_INFO
00136     namespace boost {
00137     namespace serialization {
00138     template<class T>
00139     struct extended_type_info_impl {
00140         typedef BOOST_DEDUCED_TYPENAME 
00141             boost::serialization::extended_type_info_typeid<T> type;
00142     };
00143     } // namespace serialization
00144     } // namespace boost
00145 #endif
00146 
00147 #ifdef BOOST_MSVC
00148 #pragma warning(pop)
00149 #endif
00150 #include <boost/config/abi_suffix.hpp> // pops abi_suffix.hpp pragmas
00151 
00152 #endif // BOOST_SERIALIZATION_EXTENDED_TYPE_INFO_TYPEID_HPP
